articles.title: PM Modi lands in China after seven years; to meet Xi, Putin
articles.description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi arrived in Tianjin, China, to attend the Shanghai Cooperation Organization (SCO) summit. He is scheduled to hold bilateral meetings with Chinese President Xi Jinping and Russian President Vladimir Putin. The discussions are expected to cover regional security, economic cooperation, and global issues. Modi and Xi are also set to discuss the long-standing border dispute between India and China.

articles.title: At least 3 killed, over 90 injured after passenger train derails in Egypt
articles.description: A passenger train derailed in western Egypt, killing at least three people and injuring 94 others. The train was traveling to Cairo from the Matrouh province when seven of its wagons went off the tracks, with two overturning. An investigation is underway to determine the cause of the accident, which is the latest in a series of rail crashes in Egypt.

articles.title: Chicago's mayor prepares for Trump's troops, a court rules Trump's tariffs are illegal
articles.description: Chicago's mayor has signed an executive order instructing city police and departments not to cooperate with any troop deployment to the city. This comes as a federal appeals court ruled that President Trump could not unilaterally implement most of his massive tariffs on imports, stating that the power to impose tariffs is vested in the legislative branch. Trump has indicated he will appeal the decision.
